text: John Farr Abbott, sometimes Abbot (1756 - 22 September 1794) was a British barrister. He was a member of Lincoln's Inn, and became a Fellow of the Society of Antiquaries of London and a Fellow of the Royal Society. He also served as Clerk of Rules in the Court of King's Bench. He died in York and is buried in York Minster. ==See also== ==References== *Fellows of the Royal Society *Minister Burial Records Category:Place of birth missing Category:1756 births Category:1794 deaths Category:18th-century Welsh lawyers Category:Welsh barristers Category:Fellows of the Royal Society Category:Fellows of the Society of Antiquaries of London Category:Burials at York Minster
title: John Farr Abbott
